meanings.definition: A sound made by air escaping rapidly from a small opening.
meanings.sent1: The hish of the deflating balloon was loud.
meanings.sent2: I heard a hish when I opened the soda can.
meanings.sent3: The hish of the wind through the trees was calming.
meanings.sent4: The hish of the tire losing air was like a soft sigh.
meanings.sent5: The hish of the steam escaping from the kettle was sharp and sudden.

meanings.sent1: She tried to hish the cat away from the food.
meanings.sent2: I will hish softly to call the dog over.
meanings.sent3: He hished urgently to get his friend's attention.
meanings.sent4: The wind hished through the leaves like a gentle whisper.
meanings.sent5: The teacher hished the students to be quiet during the test.

meanings.sent1: The hish of the river flowing was soothing.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the hish of the waves on the shore.
meanings.sent3: The hish of the leaves in the wind sounded like a secret.
meanings.sent4: The hish of the rain on the roof was like a lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The hish of the crowd murmuring filled the room.
